title: (x) Lula Mag display face - Kursivschrift {Michael A}
content:
Hello Typophiles

I came across this lovely magazine in London and have fallen in love with the display font used in it.  
Anyone know what it is and who sells the licence.  
Cheers

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706083307im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Lula_Type02_4755.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706083307im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Lula_Type_4804.jpg)

 [‹ good magazine](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706083307/http:/www.typophile.com/node/42000 "Go to previous forum topic") [Heavy script on Tópas Icelandic candy packaging ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706083307/http:/www.typophile.com/node/41981 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Gregers™

comments.content:
That would be a slightly modified Kursivschrift. Similar to Fling.

[http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/kursivschrift\_virtual/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706083307/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/kursivschrift_virtual/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/linotype/kursivschrift\_virtual/")

Thank you for that one. I thought it was Fling at first but now i see it is this one.  
I dont even think it has been modified it just looks like the Stehend version, which is cheap as well. Nice One  
Cheers

Hi Gregers, in case you’re interested — you can find previously identified ID request by doing a search and limiting the results to the Typophile.com website, like [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706083307/http:/www.google.com/search?q=site:typophile.com%20lula%20magazine). As you can see, the Lula magazine display face has been discussed a couple of times before. It always helps to do a search first, this saves you some time.

Hi Bald Condensed  
Been away for awhile, but never too late to say thanks, i guess. :-)  
So thanks alot for that, very handy.  
Cheers
